wd:Report_Entry.wd:title: Platform Administrator
wd:Report_Entry.wd:description:
Customer Care Platform Administrator

Full Time - Permanent Contract

Peterborough - Hybrid (post training)

At Aegon UK, we are united through a single, clear purpose: Helping people live their best lives.

People are living longer than ever before, and at Aegon UK we're excited by the opportunities this brings. As a purpose-led business, we're focused on supporting our customers as they navigate through new stages of their lives and all the moments that matter.

Following a period of growth and transformation, we are growing our Customer Care teams across the UK, in this case Peterborough.

We Step Up: As a Platform Administrator you’re on the front line, the face of our business, the person that our customers rely on to help them manage their financial wellbeing. You’ll answer inbound calls from our customers and help them use the Aegon Platform to manage their money.

We Tune In: We take responsibility for our customers satisfaction by listening to their needs and communicating in clear and easy to understand language. We are also hungry to learn and treat every day as a development opportunity. We get the best out of ourselves and each other.

We are a Force For Good: We help our customers with the big stuff, for the moments that matter: Pensions, Savings, and Investments. We do this through the Aegon Platform, an online service which lets our customers keep the important things in one place, so it’s easier for them to make decisions and plan for their future.

We’ll train you. We’re not looking for financial experts (though they are very welcome!). When you join us, you’ll go straight into our Platform Academy and learn from some of our experts. Before you deal with customers, we’ll give you the skills and knowhow to delight and support them. All you need to bring is your hunger to learn, a drive to solve problems and the compassion to keep your customers wellbeing at the heart of every interaction.

We’d love to hear from you if:

  • You’ve got experience in customer service (contact centre, face-to-face, retail, hospitality – that kind of thing)
  • You’re a good communicator with an eye for detail.
  • You can put yourself in a customer’s shoes, taking ownership and working flexibly to meet their expectations.
  • You know your way around typical Microsoft Office tools like Outlook, Teams, Word, Excel

Successful applicants will be contacted to arrange an initial telephone screening call, then if we are in agreement and happy to progress, you will be invited to interview in person in our new office in Lynchwood Business Park.

How we’ll look after you:

  • Our entry-level salary is £23,400 (or £12ph) but we’re flexible up to £27,700 (£14.21ph) depending on the experience you can bring, (to hit £25K+ you will currently work in pensions and have been in that role for 3+ years)
  • We’ll help you develop and grow with our Pay & Progression scheme. By becoming an expert in your role and delivering exceptional service at the highest quality, your financial reward can grow up to £33,240 (£17.05ph)
  • A non-contributory pension between 8%-12%
  • A discretionary annual bonus, depending on personal and company performance.
  • 34 days leave per year (including bank holidays, pro-rated for part-time)
  • We know our staff have busy lives and commitments outside work, so we work flexibly where possible and have a hybrid approach to office working, typically 2 days in the office per week, three from home. You will be on site for the duration of your training.
  • We also offer private medical cover, life assurance, critical illness cover, enhanced parental leave and a variety of lifestyle benefits to help our staff live their best lives, including retail discount vouchers, cycle2work scheme, subsidised restaurant, online GP appointments and travel loans.

The legal bits

We’ll need you to confirm you have the right to work in the UK. If we offer you a job and you accept, there are some checks we need to complete before you can start with us. This will include a credit and criminal record check, as well as providing satisfactory references.

We are an equal opportunities employer and welcome applications from all suitably qualified persons regardless of their age, disability, race, religion/belief, gender, sexual orientation, or gender identity.

Permanent

Closing date: 2nd August 2024

We’re a company of ambitious, collaborative, problem-solvers who get things done. Our mission is to help people achieve a lifetime of financial security, and we’re investing in innovation that can make people’s finances work harder.  From a Digital Experience that gives one-stop access to a universe of investment opportunity – to retirement products that make wealth planning simple, easy and fulfilling – we’re dedicated to getting people closer to their financial goals every day.

We help people live their best lives. We help them with the big stuff, for the moments that matter: Pensions, Savings, Investments. At Aegon, we strive in creating a diverse organisation that plays a meaningful role in driving greater equity, inclusion and belonging.

Technology is at the centre of our organisation, it’s pivotal to the way we do business everyday and achieving our mission.  Our technology organisation is transforming we want to change how we work, improve our technology architecture incrementally, be better at engineering, building out our data capability and drive innovation.

As a Principal Engineer, you will be responsible for leading and overseeing the development and solution architecture of complex applications, ensuring high-quality code, and driving technical excellence across our team. This is a role where your deep understanding of open-source technologies, extensive experience with AWS, expertise in automation, and proficiency in ReactNative and AngularJS frameworks will truly support our business. You will also run and operate each capability through all lifecycle stages including production environments to ensure it operates within defined SLAs.

In addition to this you will:

  • Lead and drive the technical delivery for our technology strategy, making decisions that shape how we build and standardise our digital products
  • Provide the strategic way forward from an engineering perspective on all fronts from solution to implementation, including but not limited to solution, engineering, best practices, governance, security and data (APIs).
  • Lead and demonstrate the qualities you want to instil in your team of full stack developers, providing training and development, technical guidance, code reviews, and fostering a culture of continuous improvement.
  • Drive the architect, design, and develop robust and scalable web applications using ReactNative, AngularJS, and other relevant technologies which will define our service.

We’d love to hear from you if you have:

  • Extensive experience as a Lead Full Stack Developer, with a strong focus on web application development.
  • A solid understanding of front-end and back-end technologies, including ReactNative, AngularJS, Node.js, HTML, CSS, JavaScript, and related frameworks.
  • Strong development experience in the delivery of traditional code artefacts (Java/Python/SQL, etc…) and in addition IaC artefacts (Cloud Formation/Terraform/AWS CLI)
  • Deep expertise in AWS services and architecture, including EC2, S3, Lambda, API Gateway, and DynamoDB, amongst others.
  • Strong understanding of software engineering principles, design patterns, and best practices for scalable and maintainable code.
  • Experience in conducting workshops or meetings to gather business requirements and facilitate productive discussions between business and technical teams.

What’s in it for you?

  • A non-contributory pension between 8%-12%
  • A discretionary bonus, depending on personal and company performance
  • 34 days leave per year (including bank holidays, pro-rated for part-time)

We also offer private medical cover, life assurance, critical illness cover, enhanced parental leave and a variety of lifestyle benefits to help our staff live their best lives, including retail discount vouchers, cycle2work scheme, subsidised restaurant and online GP appointments.

Transformation change is never easy and if this excites you as much as it does us, we would love to hear from you.

wd:Report_Entry.wd:title: Digital Delivery Lead
wd:Report_Entry.wd:description:
Digital Delivery Lead

Permanent

Location: Edinburgh, Witham, or Peterborough (typically 2 days in the office per week, 3 from home)

Expected starting salary: £56,480 - £70,600

Closing date: 25th July 2024

Who we are:

Global Technology Services (GTS) is Aegon's global IT partner that provides infrastructure services, information security and global/corporate application support for Aegon's businesses around the world.

From 6 locations in the US, the Netherlands, UK, and Hungary, we support 20+ country units and 24000+ employees in the world. Our support consists of a wide range of centralized global IT services such as programming, database management, project management, agile/dev/ops, and more.

We continue to maximize the value from having a clear digital and data technology platform strategy that extends our ecosystem, as an approach to digitization, enhancing customer experience, and improving operational efficiency.

All these teams work closely together to provide innovative and digital solutions as well as critical technology support. This is essential for enabling Aegon's businesses around the globe to be innovative, digital, and competitive, efficient, and effective, and to provide the best solutions and customer experience for our customers and shareholders.

The Job:

This role will be part of the Global Engineering & Architecture function within the Global Technology Services group. The Global Engineering & Architecture function is responsible for Architecture, Standards, and Governance across the organisation.

In this exciting new role for the company, you’ll be leading a development team with a strategic focus on building common solutions that can be leveraged across the entire organisation. Your team’s mission will be to create innovative and adaptable software solutions that enhance productivity, streamline processes, and drive competitive advantage. Here are some key aspects of your role:

  • As the team lead, you’ll set the vision for your team. You’ll inspire and guide them toward creating solutions that align with the organisation’s goals. Your leadership will be crucial in fostering collaboration, creativity, and a growth mindset.

  • Given your initial focus on Generative AI, you’ll explore cutting-edge techniques and tools to infuse AI capabilities into your solutions. This could involve natural language processing, computer vision, or other AI-driven approaches.

  • You’ll bridge developers, project managers, and stakeholders to ensure everyone is aligned. Effective communication and collaboration will be essential to keep the team motivated and productive.

  • You’ll actively ensure that the organisation’s System Development Life Cycle (SDLC) is followed rigorously. This means overseeing requirements gathering, design, development, testing, deployment, and maintenance.

  • Adopting agile methodologies will allow your team to iterate quickly, respond to changing requirements, and deliver value incrementally. Scrum, Kanban, or a hybrid approach can help streamline development processes.

  • Work closely with other teams (such as data science, design, and product management) to ensure holistic solutions. Cross-functional collaboration fosters innovation and prevents silos.

  • Leverage modern tech stacks, cloud services, and DevOps practices. Integrating tools effectively will enhance development speed and quality.

  • Expect obstacles, whether technical, organisational, or cultural. Your role involves problem-solving, adaptability, and resilience.

  • Take charge of the team’s backlog. Prioritize features, epics, and user stories based on business value, technical feasibility, and customer needs. Your decisions will shape the product roadmap.

  • Create an internal community around a federated development model. Encourage collaboration, knowledge sharing, and best practices. This model accelerates feature development across platforms.

  • Lead by example. Dive into development tasks alongside your team. Your hands-on approach fosters camaraderie, inspires quality work, and keeps you connected to the codebase.

We’d love to hear from you if you have:

  • Keen interest in AI, and how its application can shape our technological future. Previous applied experience working with AI tools is desirable, but not essential.

  • Experience delivering AWS cloud solutions (PaaS, IaaS, SaaS), data platforms and engineering capability in a regulated environment.

  • Proficiency in Python programming.

  • Delivery mechanisms including both iterative and waterfall across multi-disciplinary teams.

  • Previous experience of transforming and leading ways of working in a regulated environment and effectively using JIRA, Confluence, Teams as productivity and collaboration tools.

  • Ability to build a culture of innovation and foster a strong team culture.

  • Ability to work across internal and external teams.

What’s in it for you?

  • A non-contributory pension between 8%-12%

  • A discretionary bonus, depending on personal and company performance

  • 34 days leave per year (including bank holidays, pro-rated for part-time)

We also offer private medical cover, life assurance, critical illness cover, enhanced parental leave and a variety of lifestyle benefits to help our staff live their best lives, including retail discount vouchers, cycle2work scheme, subsidised restaurant, and online GP appointments.

The legal bits

We’ll need you to confirm you have the right to work in the UK. If we offer you a job and you accept, there are some checks we need to complete before you can start with us. This will include a credit and criminal record check, as well as providing satisfactory references.

The Technology Delivery organisation is responsible for technology and delivery for Retail, Workplace and Customer Care Value Streams, alongside the wider portfolio consisting of Regulatory, Finance, HR and Information Security related projects.  This consists of both modern Digital and Data capabilities run in the Cloud, as well as current technologies that have enabled the business over many years. 

To provide clear visibility of deliveries across the Technology Delivery organisation and deliver change through a transparent delivery model being inclusive of stakeholders and technology teams, we are now looking for Technology Owners to join us. In this role you will be responsible for delivering the technical capabilities required for the Value Stream, where you will understand the business drivers and priorities, as well as the Technology strategy, focusing on balancing the short and long term outcomes.

This is the major difference in the shift to Product thinking. It's not just about creating a superior product or service, it’s also about building the infrastructure and capacity to deliver a continuously improving product or service for the product lifetime. With this long term view of product, cultivation and maintenance of the value stream must be prioritised against just delivering new features. You will also be responsible for:

  • Leading complex solution planning and execution to meet customer needs, in collaboration with the Value Stream leadership team, delivering high-value changes incrementally.
  • Identifying and developing necessary skills within the value stream team.
  • Act as an escalation point, removing blockers and ensuring smooth workflow.
  • Foster a customer-focused environment, breaking down barriers between teams and departments.
  • Stay updated on industry trends and recommend tools/technologies for improvement.
  • Inspire and champion technology, enabling delivery teams to build exceptional products and helping business leaders gain a deeper understanding of the underlying technology.     
  • Embed a culture for efficient delivery within technology, driving a mindset shift across technology and the wider organisation.
  • Ensure stakeholders such as Information Security, Technology Risk are engaged as part of Software Development Lifecycle.

We’d love to hear from you if you have:

  • Experience in working in agile and traditional delivery methods with a broad understanding across all areas of the SDLC to allow effective delivery and reporting.
  • Proven technical programme management experience in taking major technology deliveries from idea to implementation with the ability to context switch between multiple major priorities.
  • Experience in managing teams across multiple locations.
  • Experience in managing multiple stakeholders at senior levels of a large organisation.
  • Effective influencing and negotiation skills in an environment where resources are not in direct management control.
  • An entrepreneurial drive, with the ability to deconstruct and solve problems, to investigate drivers and figure out why things happen.
  • Excellent verbal and written communication skills, including the ability to act as a conduit between technical and business teams.

As part of a Global Audit function, you will get the opportunity to work on implementing global strategies and you’ll be providing the skills and insight to understand the quality and effectiveness of the Aegon framework in an independent and objective way, reporting information to key stakeholders and governance forums.   • Well versed at supervising and mentoring Audit team members

  • Exceptional experience of regulatory risk and enterprise risk management frameworks

  • Be a fantastic communicator both verbally and in writing with the ability to explain complex and sometimes challenging information in an easy to understand way with stakeholders at all levels
